OSS590.name: Special Problems
OSS590.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
OSS590.description: Each student works under faculty direction on an experimental, theoretical, or applied problem.
OSS590.restrictions: Open only to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine. Approval of department.

OSS602.name: Primary Care Ambulatory Clerkship
OSS602.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
OSS602.description: A 24-week ambulatory care continuity experience involving 12 weeks in a multidisciplinary environment (family medicine, pediatrics, and internal medicine), 4 weeks in family medicine and 8 weeks in specialty areas (internal medicine, surgery, pediatrics, and obstetrics and gynecology). Didactic sessions are scheduled concurrently.

OSS603.name: Core Clinical Concepts
OSS603.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
OSS603.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.

OSS620.name: Directed Studies
OSS620.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
OSS620.description: Individual or group work on special problems in medicine.
OSS620.restrictions: Open only to graduate-professional students in the College of Osteopathic Medicine.
